comments.body:
It's a special value, which should be returned by binary special methods, we could have a raise for `NotImplementedError`. 

More info here: https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#NotImplemented
May you provide a bit more info about this type? Say any link reference to requests doc relating to this? Thanks.

you can find more info here: https://requests.readthedocs.io/en/master/api/#requests.PreparedRequest

If I am not wrong your request here it to provide a link in the comment (here) but not in the code!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +335,339 @@        self.token = token

    def __call__(self, r: PreparedRequest) -> PreparedRequest:
        r.headers['Authorization'] = 'Bearer ' + self.token
        return r
